definition: to announce good news/to report success
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad
to report only the good news, not the bad news/to hold back unpleasant news/to sweep bad news under the carpet

sentences.english: Our Chineseare are good at tell the good news, not but the bad news.
sentences.chinese: 我们中国人最擅长的，便是报喜不报忧。

sentences.english: Fan Chin returned home and told his mother and wife, Madam Hu, his good news.
sentences.chinese: 范进回家向母亲和妻子胡氏报喜。

sentences.english: Every15-year-old boy tells his mother is fine.
sentences.chinese: 任何一个十五岁的男孩对他妈妈总是报喜不报忧。

sentences.english: You love your home, in the back just unpleasant.
sentences.chinese: 你爱家，在外回来只报喜不报忧。

sentences.english: Just as the angel bears a lily-stem in the Annunciation.
sentences.chinese: 就像《天使报喜图》中手捧百合干枝的天使。

sentences.english: Daniel fell in love with his girlfriend 8 years of good news to the media.
sentences.chinese: 相恋8年旳吴彦祖与女友向各媒体报喜。

sentences.english: Many hikingmates were taking out mobile to report good news and safety.
sentences.chinese: 大家纷纷拿出手机报喜报平安了。

sentences.english: So I took "The Annunciation" home and fed it to our rabbit.
sentences.chinese: 我把“天使报喜”带回家，拿去喂我家的兔子。

sentences.english: In 1996, Baoxiniao Group Co. , Ltd. was officially founded.
And there are lots of good things happening, they just don't make the news.
sentences.chinese: 更多的好事正在发生，只不过媒体是报忧不报喜。

sentences.english: But thee We only sent to give glad tidings and admonition.
sentences.chinese: 我只派遣你为报喜者和警告者。

sentences.english: Reports of success on all fronts came in quick succession.
sentences.chinese: 全国各条战线纷纷报喜。

sentences.english: Baoxiniao started making men's suits in the early 1980's.
sentences.chinese: 80年代初，报喜鸟开始生产男装。

definition: two simultaneous happy events in the family
to congratulate respectfully/to express good wishes
to add a son to the family
joy from heaven (idiom); overjoyed at unexpected good news/unlooked-for happy event
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
